newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: ARA bunkers head down, other areas still rising.
newsitem.headline: ARA bunkers head down, other areas still rising.

text.p: ARA bunker prices fell on Wednesday as the price spiral inspired by the Iraqi crisis unwound, but bunkers in other areas still rose, traders said.
Rotterdam trade was very thin after a quick burst of activity early on Tuesday. Fuel oil 380 CST was talked in a range $108/$110 fob ARA, down around $4 from Tuesday's peak.
"A few people want to get rid of the fuel oil they bought on Tuesday so the prices had to drop," one trader said. Dealers assessed Wednesday's bunker demand at less than 10,000 tonnes.
Hamburg prices were about $1 a tonne weaker, 380 CST at $113/$114. Activity was also slight.
Southern France bunkers dropped by $1, Italian bunkers were steady, but Spanish prices were $1 higher and, further east, in Greece and Egypt, prices were up by around $5 a tonne.
Dealers said bunkers in the eastern Mediterranean were catching up with gains elsewhere.
Durban prices also rose in a market almost devoid of fuel oil as one refiner continued to recommission its crude furnace. Traders said the position would not ease until the last week of September.
